intro: Nothopanax cissodendron, commonly known as the false soursop, is a tropical plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is native to Central and South America, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features a slender, woody stem with compound leaves that are alternate and pinnately arranged. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, typically clustered in umbels, and it produces a fruit that resembles a small, spiky berry. The botanical characteristics of Nothopanax cissodendron make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
